attachments.fallback: Donald Miner commented on determine the list of perks we are willing to give out to users: "@davidkeatts1 i was thinking it could be used more on sleeves, deckboxes, and the other shit we eventually put up on the store."

attachments.pretext: New comment on *<https://trello.com/c/Mm2OKXUs|determine the list of perks we are willing to give out to users>*

attachments.fallback:
Donald Miner commented on determine the list of perks we are willing to give out to users: "@davidkeatts1 For a time gated feature... it would be obviously easier if its just a new set of pages. Like if we added a deck help forum or a new type of page. I don't think this happens very often.  The other feature I want to do somewhat shortly after we roll out user accounts is a "personalized deck analysis section" where you sync up your Archidekt account to our service. We log which decks you have, let you refresh them, get updates on what new cards you should pick up for your deck when a new set comes out, few other things. This could be harder to carve out since some of the features are integrated with the rest of the site. 

The other thing we could do is just put up a "staging" server that only beta people have access to. Might be good for us to do testing in this way with a smaller number of users as well."
attachments.text:
@davidkeatts1 For a time gated feature... it would be obviously easier if its just a new set of pages. Like if we added a deck help forum or a new type of page. I don't think this happens very often.  The other feature I want to do somewhat shortly after we roll out user accounts is a "personalized deck analysis section" where you sync up your Archidekt account to our service. We log which decks you have, let you refresh them, get updates on what new cards you should pick up for your deck when a new set comes out, few other things. This could be harder to carve out since some of the features are integrated with the rest of the site. 

The other thing we could do is just put up a "staging" server that only beta people have access to. Might be good for us to do testing in this way with a smaller number of users as well.
attachments.pretext: New comment on *<https://trello.com/c/Mm2OKXUs|determine the list of perks we are willing to give out to users>*

attachments.fallback:
Donald Miner commented on instead of regional price source being one choice, i'd like people to be able to choose up to 3 of a list of options.: "@davidkeatts1 Right now you have one dropdown box for the regional price source. We have three slots for prices under cards. I'd like to be able to choose what goes into each of those slots. For example, I don't care about MTGO prices one bit, so I'm going to pick cardkingdom, tcgplayer, and hareruya (even if they are japanese because sometimes you can get sick deals and put up with the shipping headache) -- just an example. Or maybe i'm a player that cares about mtgo and nothing else, so i'm just going to have mtgo pricing and two blanks.
"
attachments.text: @davidkeatts1 Right now you have one dropdown box for the regional price source. We have three slots for prices under cards. I'd like to be able to choose what goes into each of those slots. For example, I don't care about MTGO prices one bit, so I'm going to pick cardkingdom, tcgplayer, and hareruya (even if they are japanese because sometimes you can get sick deals and put up with the shipping headache) -- just an example. Or maybe i'm a player that cares about mtgo and nothing else, so i'm just going to have mtgo pricing and two blanks.
